events.text: As everyone sits around the campfire, you can feel a strong sense of unity amongst the others as they prepare the rabbits and conversate.
While Camille sticks the rabbits to roast near the fire, Lowen retells a story about life before the incident.
Although tired of the retelling, Alistair makes snide remarks with a slight smirk seeing Lowen’s theatrics with Julian as they pretend to fight one another.
Julian punches Lowen in slow motion who ridiculously spins around after being hit and flips over the fallen tree next to you.
Everyone burst out laughing seeing Lowen’s snow covered boots dangling up in the air!
As the laughter settles, Julian continues with the story, but as you look over you can see a concerned, almost sad, expression on Lowen’s face.
You never seen Lowen so focused, yet worried, about something else while he lies in the snow.
You choose to remain quiet and observe Lowen who’s mind was captive by thoughts that seemed to be doing more harm than good.
You’ve never seen such discomfort and sadness on his face before and it genuinely concerns you.
After closing his eyes for a bit of time, he slowly opens them before noticing you watching him.
[i]Hey, are you alright?[/i]
[i]Hm?[/i]
[i]Yeah, yeah, it’s all part of the story![/i]
[i]I’m just waiting for my part![/i]
[i]No, I mean-[/i]
A huge cartoonish grin quickly shoots across his face as he shakes his hand for you to help him.
You both grab each other by the forearm and Lowen shoots himself up.
And that’s how my younger brother gave me that scar!
Pretty funny, huh?
Y-Yeah…
I didn’t think he’d be strong enough to crack me cranium, but I guess granite counters are just that tough!
You know, I think you’re on to something with that punchline.
It actually made me think of laughing this time.
Oh yeah?
Close enough to getting you to finally crack, eh?
I’ll add it to my notes!
Ugh, this again...
Lowen takes out a notebook and pen.
‘Crack me Cranium almost made Alistair laugh.’
‘Will constantly use around him until he finally laughs.’
You’ll be doing nothing, but wasting your time and annoying me.
Or wot?
You’ll crack me cranium?!
You’ll do me head in?!
Everyone laughs at Lowen who points at Alistair teasing him for even a chuckle.
Alistair scoffs as he takes a drink from his canteen.
[wave amp=50.0 freq=6.0 connected=1]Awww~, come on~![wave]
Now that Lowen’s comedy routine is over.
I was able to get more of our mission details of Gaia’s next chosen site for restoration.
Everyone sits up ready to listen.

events.file: res://background music/General Background Music/Acid Trip - Rumbling Tension.wav

events.text: As you all know, we’re heading south, but we’ve been assigned out hub of operations in a town called Torrance in North Carolina.
We’re actually not too far away from North Carolina, right?
I remember seeing some signs a while back.
That’s correct; however, this town is in Huntersville…
A strange sense of uneasiness comes over everyone that seems to miss your understanding.
What’s with Huntersville?
Something happen there?
Under normal circumstances, I’d ridicule you for not knowing the obvious, but with you being contained for well over a year, it makes sense that you don’t know.
After the incident, there was uncontrollable chaos throughout the country and the world.
While governments tried to do what they could to regain that control, other ‘organizations’ rose up and claimed it for themselves.
H.U.N.T.R. being one of those organizations.
A violent one at that.
I've only heard of the name recently...
Which doesn't bode well for us.
Although recently making themselves known, they've clearly have earned quite the repuation for themselves already.
Can’t say I’ve heard of them.
And it makes sense that you haven’t, they’ve only recent tried to stake their claim in things.
Humanity’s Union for its Next Resurgence, H.U.N.T.R.
There’s a lot of suspicions on their origin considering the strength in which they seem to possess.
A government faction that always secretly existed, a terrorist group fiending for the right moment…
Whoever they are, what is unanimously understood about them is that they’re a threat.
To Gaia’s Advocates, to whatever government that remains, and any living and breathing person.
As the name suggest, they hunt anyone who they deem inadequate for the continuance of humanity.
An extremist organization actively practicing genocide in this country…
Of all times, why now?
After the damage you caused, one would think that Gaia and its creatures have endured enough at this point, but that answer evades all of us.
No use in understanding savages.
What is useful is knowing are enemy.
Rumors suggest that Huntersville, North Carolina serves as a growing hub for the extremist group.
Based on our informant on site, there’s talks of a large-scale battle breaking out in the town in order to stop that.
By who?
The government has sent soldiers to a town not too far in order to act as a deterrent, but they’ve starting bolstering their numbers lately.
They suspect it’s any day now.
H.U.N.T.R being based in Huntersville?
Isn’t that a little too obvious?
Regardless of whether or not this place is a stronghold for H.U.N.T.R., what’s important is that we do our upmost not to get involved with the situation.
As we are currently, we’re nothing close to being capable in surviving such a strife nor is it necessary.
All we need to do is meet with our informant, gain as much information in regards to the McGuire power plant, set up the RAFs and leave undetected.
Stealth and discretion are our sole priority in being successful for Gaia’s sake.
The issues of the town are inconsequential to our mission.
If anything, it could act as a great distraction in the event anything is to occur while we're present.
As much as I'd hate to not help the people that will be caught in the middle of this mess...
That sounds like a good idea.
Staying out of sight, out of mind, will keep all of us safe as well.
That being a priority as well, of course.
Right…
[b]Then that doesn’t leave us much room to get extra parts or anything like that…[/b]
Not exactly, no…
Well, if this civil war is on the cusp of breaking out any minute now, where do we stay in order to remain hidden?
Lowen points at Camille with approval of her question.
Excellent question.
Luckily for us, our informant claims of a tavern with lodging that acts as a point of neutrality that all sides are forced to respect.
Really now?
Due to the high volume of people that pass through, we’d be able to easily blend in and they’ve already offered us housing for our time there.
Is that so?
They also sell various goods that we could find useful, so-
S-So you mean?!
Yes...
They could sell-
[wave amp=50.0 freq=6.0 connected=1]WOOHOO~![wave]
Julian shoots up with glee as he races around the camp.
Sit down!
We’re not done here!
S-Sorry…
You see, that.
That kind of behavior is what we need to avoid while we’re there!
[shake rate=60.0 level=8 connected=1]R-Right, sorry, sorry…[shake]
So we meet with the contact at this tavern.
Avoid the conflict in the town while operating in secret.
Maybe buy some useful parts for me to make something cool!
Maybe!
But overall, we do what we do best, help save the planet, and be on our merry way before anything hits the fan.
I cannot stress enough how important it is that we remain anonymous during our time there.
Outside of that, we’ll learn more on site and go from there.
That concludes our briefing.
If we sleep in shifts starting now and leave early morning, we should arrive mid-day.
[wave amp=50.0 freq=6.0 connected=1]Alrighty then~![wave]
Lowen leans back as he stretches.
Everyone starts to clean up and pack things back into the truck.
As you make your way towards the truck you hear Alistair scoff.
I didn’t know we had two comedians in our mist.
Who’s that?
You and Lowen, if you think you’re sleeping first after being asleep the entire ride over here.
Camille!
Camille looks over at you and Alistair as she tossing some sticks into the campfire.
‘It’ will keep you company and Julian when he takes over your shift.
*sigh*
Whine all you want.
I don’t care.
Alistair steps extremely close to you jamming his pistol into your abdomen.
[i]Please, for my sake, try and escape again.[/i]
[i]Allow me that luxury.[/i]
Alistair walks away with a sinister smirk.
I’ll be here in the event of anything.
Alistair climbs on top of the truck and begins to concentrate as ethereal energy surrounds him again.
[i]This shit is getting old…[/i]
I’ll meet you out there in a few hours!
Maybe we can talk about movies to stay awake!
Don’t let the fire burn out!
Julian climbs into the back of the truck.
[i]You’ll be alright, you’ll be alright. [/i]
[i]Will I?[/i]
Lowen shrugs his shoulder with an apologetic smile.
[i]Maybe?[/i]
[i]I'd hold off on skipping town if I were you for tonight.[/i]
[i]At least for tonight.[/i]
[i]I’ll see you in the morning, alright?[/i]
[i]Yeah, yeah…[/i]
Lowen aggressively pats your shoulder before climbing into the back of the truck.
[i]Guess we’re staying up…[/i]
